metadata.title: CVE-2020-1751 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds write vulnerability was found in glibc before 2.31 whenhandling signal trampolines on PowerPC. Specifically, the backtracefunction did not properly check the array bounds when storing the frameaddress, resulting in a denial of service or potential code execution. Thehighest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-1751` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc-bin - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc6 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc6-amd64 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc6-armel - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc6-i386 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc6-pic - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc6-ppc64 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc6-s390 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
libc6-x32 - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
locales - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
locales-all - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
multiarch-support - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
nscd - 2.23-0ubuntu11.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.23-0ubuntu11.2').
